articles.headline: Inside a Brazen Scheme to Woo China: Gifts, Golf and a $4,254 Wine
articles.snippet: Confidential documents detail Deutsche Bank’s influence campaign and hiring practices in China. More than 100 relatives of top Communist Party officials got jobs.
articles.abstract: Confidential documents detail Deutsche Bank’s influence campaign and hiring practices in China. More than 100 relatives of top Communist Party officials got jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a brazen campaign to win business in China by charming and enriching the country’s political elite.
articles.byline: By Michael Forsythe, David Enrich and Alexandra Stevenson

articles.headline: Epstein Estate’s First Legal Bill in Fight Against Accusers: $90,000
articles.snippet: The financier Jeffrey Epstein died two months ago while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges, and the court actions involving his estate are getting into gear.
articles.abstract: The financier Jeffrey Epstein died two months ago while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges, and the court actions involving his estate are getting into gear.
articles.lead_paragraph: The federal criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein ended with his death two months ago, but the legal battles by his estate are poised to go on for months to come.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Steve Eder

articles.headline: The New Makers of Plant-Based Meat? Big Meat Companies
articles.snippet: Tyson, Smithfield, Perdue and Hormel have all rolled out meat alternatives, filling supermarket shelves with an array of plant-based burgers, meatballs and chicken nuggets.
articles.abstract: Tyson, Smithfield, Perdue and Hormel have all rolled out meat alternatives, filling supermarket shelves with an array of plant-based burgers, meatballs and chicken nuggets.
articles.lead_paragraph: Beyond Meat and Impossible Foods, scrappy start-ups that share a penchant for superlatives and a commitment to protecting the environment, have dominated the relatively new market for vegetarian food that looks and tastes like meat.

articles.headline: Assad Forces Surge Forward in Syria as U.S. Pulls Back
articles.snippet: Syrian government forces streamed into the country’s northeast, filling a vacuum opened up by President Trump’s decision to pull back in Syria.
articles.abstract: Syrian government forces streamed into the country’s northeast, filling a vacuum opened up by President Trump’s decision to pull back in Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOHUK, Iraq — Syrian government forces streamed into the country’s northeast on Monday, seizing towns where they had not set foot in years and filling a vacuum opened up by President Trump’s decision to abandon the United States’ Syrian Kurdish allies.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: AMC Theater Chain Gets Into Streaming With On-Demand Movies
articles.snippet: AMC Entertainment dominates the cineplex business. Now it also wants to be a major player in home viewing.
articles.abstract: AMC Entertainment dominates the cineplex business. Now it also wants to be a major player in home viewing.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — In a sign of just how much streaming is changing Hollywood, movie fans will soon be able to rent and buy films for viewing at home — from a movie theater chain.

articles.headline: Can Joe Biden Deliver the Debate Performance He Needs?
articles.snippet: Mr. Biden in recent days has been more forceful in defending his family and denouncing the president. Some voters and Democratic officials think he should do more.
articles.abstract: Mr. Biden in recent days has been more forceful in defending his family and denouncing the president. Some voters and Democratic officials think he should do more.
articles.lead_paragraph: WESTERVILLE, Ohio — In the last few days, Joseph R. Biden Jr. has unveiled a new government ethics plan and vowed that his family members would do no business overseas during a Biden presidency. His son, Hunter Biden, said he would step down from his role with a Chinese investment firm, and sat for his first television interview of the campaign. And in Iowa, the elder Mr. Biden delivered a fist-pounding diatribe against President Trump, casting him as the embodiment of public corruption.
articles.byline: By Katie Glueck and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: In Syria, Russia Is Pleased to Fill an American Void
articles.snippet: As the United States withdraws from Syria, Russia is stepping in, running patrols to separate warring factions, striking deals and helping President Bashar al-Assad advance.
articles.abstract: As the United States withdraws from Syria, Russia is stepping in, running patrols to separate warring factions, striking deals and helping President Bashar al-Assad advance.
articles.lead_paragraph: DOHUK, Iraq — Russia asserted itself in a long-contested part of Syria on Tuesday after the United States pulled out, giving Moscow a new opportunity to press for Syrian army gains and project itself as a rising power broker in the Middle East.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard, Anton Troianovski, Carlotta Gall and Patrick Kingsley

articles.headline: Hong Kong Protesters Are Targeting Starbucks. Apple Could Be Next.
articles.snippet: Pro-democracy demonstrators have begun singling out companies that they consider enemies of their movement. Vandalism and calls for boycotts have followed.
articles.abstract: Pro-democracy demonstrators have begun singling out companies that they consider enemies of their movement. Vandalism and calls for boycotts have followed.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — One company is the world’s largest coffee chain. Another runs a Japanese restaurant empire. A third makes some of the most popular online games on the planet.

articles.headline: The Reason Your Photos Are About to Get a Lot Better
articles.snippet: Google’s Pixel 4 is the newest example of how computational photography is driving the future of phone cameras.
articles.abstract: Google’s Pixel 4 is the newest example of how computational photography is driving the future of phone cameras.
articles.lead_paragraph: Not too long ago, tech giants like Apple and Samsung raved about the number of megapixels they were cramming into smartphone cameras to make photos look clearer. Nowadays, all the handset makers are shifting focus to the algorithms, artificial intelligence and special sensors that are working together to make our photos look more impressive.
